articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: A federal prosecutor appointed by President Donald Trump asked Elon Musk for information about anyone trying to impede the work of the billionaire's government efficiency effort, warning of possible criminal sanctions, in a letter posted on platform X on Monday.
articles.title: US prosecutor warns of legal risk for anyone hindering Musk's efficiency effort

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Daphne Psaledakis, David Lawder
articles.description: Trump said he would talk with the leaders of Canada and Mexico, which have announced retaliatory tariffs of their own, but downplayed expectations that they would change his mind.
articles.title: Trump says Americans may feel 'pain' in trade war with Mexico, Canada, China

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the policies of U.S. President Donald Trump were pushing Europe to take more responsibility for its own physical and economic security.
articles.title: Russia and Trump push Europe to be more independent, Macron says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: International humanitarian law prohibits the execution of prisoners of war and the wounded, and regards it as a war crime.
articles.title: UN body reports 'alarming rise' in Russian execution of captured Ukrainian soldiers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The emotional reunion of twin brothers in Gaza after Israel allowed movement within the enclave as part of a ceasefire deal provided a visceral image of Palestinian survival after 15 gruelling months of death, separation and destruction.
articles.title: Gaza's reunited twins speak of loss and joy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will postpone threatened tariffs on Canadian imports for at least 30 days, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said in a post on X on Monday.
articles.title: Trudeau says Trump will pause Canada tariffs for at least 30 days

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Nate Raymond
articles.description: U.S. judge on Monday extended a pause on the Trump administration's plan to freeze federal loans, grants and other financial assistance, following a legal challenge from a group of advocacy organizations.
articles.title: US judge extends pause on Trump's plan to freeze federal grants, loans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates are seen by Russia as possible venues for a summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin, two Russian sources with knowledge of the discussions told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Saudi Arabia, UAE seen as possible venues for Trump-Putin summit, two Russian sources say

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Steve Holland
articles.description: Elon Musk, who has moved swiftly to shrink the size of the U.S. government at President Donald Trump's behest, is now considered a "special government employee," the White House said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump makes Musk, the world's richest man, a 'special government employee'

articles.author: Mike Stone, Erin Banco
articles.description: U.S. shipments of weapons into Ukraine were briefly paused in recent days before resuming over the weekend as the Trump administration debated its policy towards Kyiv, according to four people briefed on the matter.
articles.title: US arms shipments to Kyiv briefly paused before resuming over weekend, sources say
